pli-tv-kd14:4.1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary.
pli-tv-kd14:4.1.2: At that time Venerable Dabba the Mallian had realized perfection at the age of seven.
pli-tv-kd14:4.1.3: He had realized all there is to be realized by a disciple
pli-tv-kd14:4.1.4: and had nothing further to do.
pli-tv-kd14:4.1.5: While he was in seclusion he reflected on this,
pli-tv-kd14:4.1.9: and he thought, “How may I be of service to the Sangha?
pli-tv-kd14:4.1.11: Perhaps I could assign dwellings for the Sangha and designate the meals?”
pli-tv-kd14:4.2.1: In the evening Dabba came out of seclusion and approached the Buddha. He bowed, sat down,
pli-tv-kd14:4.2.3: “Venerable Sir, while I was in seclusion I reflected that
pli-tv-kd14:4.2.4: I’ve attained all that can be attained by a disciple,
pli-tv-kd14:4.2.7: and I was wondering how I might be of service to the Sangha.
pli-tv-kd14:4.2.9: I could assign dwellings for the Sangha and designate the meals.”
pli-tv-kd14:4.3.1: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-kd14:4.3.2: “The Sangha should appoint Dabba the Mallian as the assigner of dwellings and the designator of meals.
pli-tv-kd14:4.3.3: And he should be appointed like this.
pli-tv-kd14:4.3.5: A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:
pli-tv-kd14:4.3.6: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-kd14:4.3.7: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, it should appoint Venerable Dabba the Mallian as assigner of dwellings and designator of meals.
pli-tv-kd14:4.3.9: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-kd14:4.3.10: The Sangha appoints Venerable Dabba the Mallian as assigner of dwellings and designator of meals.
pli-tv-kd14:4.3.11: Any monk who approves of appointing Venerable Dabba the Mallian as assigner of dwellings and designator of meals should remain silent.
pli-tv-kd14:4.3.12: Any monk who does not approve should speak up.
pli-tv-kd14:4.3.13: The Sangha has appointed Venerable Dabba the Mallian as assigner of dwellings and designator of meals.
pli-tv-kd14:4.3.14: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”
pli-tv-kd14:4.4.1: Dabba assigned dwellings to the monks according to their character.
pli-tv-kd14:4.4.2: He assigned dwellings in the same place to those monks who were experts on the discourse, thinking,
pli-tv-kd14:4.4.4: And he did likewise for the experts on Monastic Law, thinking,
pli-tv-kd14:4.4.6: for the expounders of the Teaching, thinking,
pli-tv-kd14:4.4.10: and for the gossips and the body-builders, thinking,
pli-tv-kd14:4.4.11: “In this way even these venerables will be happy.”
pli-tv-kd14:4.4.12: When monks arrived at night, he entered the fire element and assigned dwellings with the help of that light.

pli-tv-kd14:4.4.15: They would approach Dabba and say,

pli-tv-kd14:4.4.30: “… in the deer park at Maddakucchi.”
pli-tv-kd14:4.4.31: Dabba then entered the fire element, and with his finger glowing, he walked in front of those monks.
pli-tv-kd14:4.4.32: They followed closely behind him with the help of that light.
pli-tv-kd14:4.4.33: And he would assign them dwellings:
pli-tv-kd14:4.4.34: “This is the bed, this the bench, this the mattress, this the pillow, this the place for defecating, this the place for urinating, this the water for drinking, this the water for washing, this the walking stick; these are the Sangha’s agreements concerning the right time to enter and the right time to depart.”
pli-tv-kd14:4.4.35: Dabba then returned to the Bamboo Grove.

pli-tv-kd14:4.6.1: At that time there was a householder who gave a regular meal of fine food to four monks.

pli-tv-kd14:4.7.11: “The meal can’t be ready, since we’re given seats at the gateway.”

pli-tv-kd14:12.3.2.9: When a procedure of further penalty has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done against one who hasn’t confessed their offense, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.
pli-tv-kd14:12.3.2.10: “When a procedure of further penalty has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done after having accused the person of their offense, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd14:12.4.0: 6.3 The group of six on wishing

pli-tv-kd14:12.4.2: he is quarrelsome, argumentative, and a creator of legal issues in the Sangha;
pli-tv-kd14:12.4.3: he is ignorant, incompetent, often committing offenses, incapable of determining whether he has committed an offense;
pli-tv-kd14:12.4.4: he is constantly and improperly socializing with householders.

pli-tv-kd14:12.5.1: “A monk who has had a legal procedure of further penalty done against himself should behave properly.
pli-tv-kd14:12.5.3: He should not give the full ordination.
pli-tv-kd14:12.5.4: He should not give formal support.

pli-tv-kd14:12.5.7.10: He should not criticize a regular monk.
pli-tv-kd14:12.5.7.11: He should not ask a regular monk for permission to accuse him of an offense.
pli-tv-kd14:12.5.7.12: He should not accuse a regular monk of an offense.

pli-tv-kd14:13.1.0: 7. Covering over as if with grass
pli-tv-kd14:13.1.1: At one time, while the monks were arguing and disputing, they did and said many things unworthy of an ascetic.
pli-tv-kd14:13.1.4: “If we deal with one another for these offenses, this legal issue might lead to harshness, nastiness, and schism.
pli-tv-kd14:13.1.5: So what should we do now?”
pli-tv-kd14:13.1.6: They told the Buddha and he said,
pli-tv-kd14:13.1.7: “It may be, monks, that monks who are arguing and disputing do and say many things unworthy of an ascetic.
pli-tv-kd14:13.1.8: If they consider this and think,
pli-tv-kd14:13.1.10: ‘If we deal with one another for these offenses, this legal issue might lead to harshness, nastiness, and schism,’ then I allow you to resolve this legal issue by covering over as if with grass.
pli-tv-kd14:13.2.1: And it should be resolved like this.
pli-tv-kd14:13.2.2: Everyone should gather in one place. A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:
pli-tv-kd14:13.2.3: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-kd14:13.2.4: While we were arguing and disputing, we did and said many things unworthy of an ascetic.
pli-tv-kd14:13.2.5: If we deal with one another for these offenses, this legal issue might lead to harshness, nastiness, and schism.
pli-tv-kd14:13.2.6: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should resolve this legal issue by covering over as if with grass, except for heavy offenses and offenses connected with householders.’
pli-tv-kd14:13.2.7: The monks belonging to one side should be informed by a competent and capable monk belonging to their own side:
pli-tv-kd14:13.2.8: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask you to listen.
pli-tv-kd14:13.2.9: While we were arguing and disputing, we did and said many things unworthy of an ascetic.
pli-tv-kd14:13.2.10: If we deal with one another for these offenses, this legal issue might lead to harshness, nastiness, and schism.
pli-tv-kd14:13.2.11: If it seems appropriate to the venerables, then for your benefit and for my own, I will confess in the midst of the Sangha both your and my own offenses by covering over as if with grass, except for heavy offenses and offenses connected with householders.’
pli-tv-kd14:13.2.12: The monks belonging to the other side should be informed by a competent and capable monk belonging to their own side:

pli-tv-kd14:14.1.1: On one occasion monks were disputing with monks, monks with nuns, and nuns with monks. Standing with the nuns, the monk Channa disputed with the monks, making others side with the nuns.
pli-tv-kd14:14.1.2: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,
pli-tv-kd14:14.1.3: “How can the monk Channa act like this?”
pli-tv-kd14:14.1.4: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha of monks gathered and questioned them:
pli-tv-kd14:14.1.5: “Is it true, monks, that the monk Channa is acting like this?”
pli-tv-kd14:14.1.8: the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-kd14:14.2.1: “Monks, there are four kinds of legal issues: legal issues arising from disputes; legal issues arising from accusations; legal issues arising from offenses; legal issues arising from business.
pli-tv-kd14:14.2.2: (1a) What is a legal issue arising from a dispute?
pli-tv-kd14:14.2.3: It may be that the monks are disputing, saying,
pli-tv-kd14:14.2.4: ‘This is the Teaching’, ‘This is contrary to the Teaching’, ‘This is the Monastic Law’, ‘This is contrary to the Monastic Law’, ‘This was spoken by the Buddha’, ‘This was not spoken by the Buddha’, ‘This was practiced by the Buddha’, ‘This was not practiced by the Buddha’, ‘This was laid down by the Buddha’, ‘This was not laid down by the Buddha’, ‘This is an offense’, ‘This is not an offense’, ‘This is a light offense’, ‘This is a heavy offense’, ‘This is a curable offense’, ‘This is an incurable offense’, ‘This is a grave offense’, or ‘This is a minor offense.’
pli-tv-kd14:14.2.5: In regard to this, whatever quarreling, arguing, conflict, disputing, variety in opinion, difference in opinion, heated speech, or strife there is—
pli-tv-kd14:14.2.6: this is called a legal issue arising from a dispute.
pli-tv-kd14:14.2.7: (1b) What is a legal issue arising from an accusation?
pli-tv-kd14:14.2.8: It may be that the monks accuse a monk of failure in morality, failure in conduct, failure in view, or failure in livelihood.
pli-tv-kd14:14.2.9: In regard to this, whatever accusation, accusing, allegation, blame, taking sides because of friendship, taking part in the accusation, or supporting the accusation there is—
pli-tv-kd14:14.2.10: this is called a legal issue arising from an accusation.
pli-tv-kd14:14.2.11: (1c) What is a legal issue arising from an offense?
pli-tv-kd14:14.2.12: There are legal issues arising from offenses because of the five classes of offenses; there are legal issues arising from offenses because of the seven classes of offenses—
pli-tv-kd14:14.2.13: this is called a legal issue arising from an offense.
pli-tv-kd14:14.2.14: (1d) What is a legal issue arising from business?
pli-tv-kd14:14.2.15: Whatever is the duty or the business of the Sangha—a legal procedure consisting of getting permission, a legal procedure consisting of one motion, a legal procedure consisting of one motion and one announcement, a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements—
pli-tv-kd14:14.2.16: this is called a legal issue arising from business.
pli-tv-kd14:14.3.1: (2a) What is the root of legal issues arising from disputes?
pli-tv-kd14:14.3.2: There are six roots of disputes that in turn are the root of legal issues arising from disputes.
pli-tv-kd14:14.3.3: There are also three unwholesome and three wholesome roots of legal issues arising from disputes.
pli-tv-kd14:14.3.4: What are the six roots of disputes that in turn are the root of legal issues arising from disputes?
pli-tv-kd14:14.3.5: It may be that a monk is angry and resentful.
pli-tv-kd14:14.3.6: One who is angry and resentful is disrespectful and undeferential toward the Teacher, the Teaching, and the Sangha, and he doesn’t fulfill the training.
pli-tv-kd14:14.3.10: Disputes are unbeneficial and a cause of unhappiness for the general population; they are harmful, detrimental, and a cause of suffering for gods and humans.
pli-tv-kd14:14.3.11: Monks, when you see such a root of disputes either in yourself or in others, you should make an effort to get rid of it.
pli-tv-kd14:14.3.12: If you don’t see such a root either in yourself or in others, you should practice so that it doesn’t reappear in the future.
pli-tv-kd14:14.3.13: In this way that bad root of disputes is abandoned.
pli-tv-kd14:14.3.15: Or it may be that a monk is denigrating and controlling,
pli-tv-kd14:14.3.16: envious and stingy, treacherous and deceitful, one who has bad desires and wrong views, or one who obstinately grasps his own views and only gives them up with difficulty.
pli-tv-kd14:14.3.17: Any of these is disrespectful and undeferential toward the Teacher, the Teaching, and the Sangha, and he doesn’t fulfill the training.
pli-tv-kd14:14.3.21: Disputes are unbeneficial and a cause of unhappiness for the general population; they are harmful, detrimental, and a cause of suffering for gods and humans.
pli-tv-kd14:14.3.22: Monks, when you see such a root of disputes either in yourself or in others, you should make an effort to get rid of it.
pli-tv-kd14:14.3.23: If you don’t see such a root either in yourself or in others, you should practice so that it doesn’t reappear in the future.
pli-tv-kd14:14.3.24: In this way that bad root of disputes is abandoned.
pli-tv-kd14:14.3.25: In this way that bad root of disputes has no future effect.
pli-tv-kd14:14.4.1: What are the three unwholesome roots of legal issues arising from disputes?
pli-tv-kd14:14.4.2: It may be that monks dispute with a mind of greed, with a mind of ill will, with a mind of delusion, saying,
pli-tv-kd14:14.4.3: ‘This is the Teaching’, ‘This is contrary to the Teaching’, ‘This is the Monastic Law’, ‘This is contrary to the Monastic Law’, ‘This was spoken by the Buddha’, ‘This was not spoken by the Buddha’, ‘This was practiced by the Buddha’, ‘This was not practiced by the Buddha’, ‘This was laid down by the Buddha’, ‘This was not laid down by the Buddha’, ‘This is an offense’, ‘This is not an offense’, ‘This is a light offense’, ‘This is a heavy offense’, ‘This is a curable offense’, ‘This is an incurable offense’, ‘This is a grave offense’, or ‘This is a minor offense.’
pli-tv-kd14:14.4.5: What are the three wholesome roots of legal issues arising from disputes?
pli-tv-kd14:14.4.6: It may be that monks dispute with a mind free from greed, free from ill will, free from delusion, saying,
pli-tv-kd14:14.4.7: ‘This is the Teaching’, ‘This is contrary to the Teaching’ …
pli-tv-kd14:14.4.8: ‘This is a grave offense’, or ‘This is a minor offense.’
pli-tv-kd14:14.5.1: (2b) What is the root of legal issues arising from accusations?
pli-tv-kd14:14.5.2: There are six roots of accusations that in turn are the root of legal issues arising from accusations.
pli-tv-kd14:14.5.3: There are also three unwholesome and three wholesome roots of legal issues arising from accusations. The body, too, is a root of legal issues arising from accusations, and so is speech.
pli-tv-kd14:14.5.4: What are the six roots of accusations that in turn are the root of legal issues arising from accusations?
pli-tv-kd14:14.5.5: It may be that a monk is angry and resentful.
pli-tv-kd14:14.5.6: One who is angry and resentful is disrespectful and undeferential toward the Teacher, the Teaching, and the Sangha, and he doesn’t fulfill the training.
pli-tv-kd14:14.5.10: Accusations are unbeneficial and a cause of unhappiness for the general population; they are harmful, detrimental, and a cause of suffering for gods and humans.
pli-tv-kd14:14.5.11: Monks, when you see such a root of accusations either in yourself or in others, you should make an effort to get rid of it.
pli-tv-kd14:14.5.12: If you don’t see such a root either in yourself or in others, you should practice so that it doesn’t reappear in the future.
pli-tv-kd14:14.5.15: Or it may be that a monk is denigrating and controlling,
pli-tv-kd14:14.5.16: envious and stingy, treacherous and deceitful, one who has bad desires and wrong views, or one who obstinately grasps his own views and only gives them up with difficulty.
pli-tv-kd14:14.5.17: Any of these is disrespectful and undeferential toward the Teacher, the Teaching, and the Sangha, and he doesn’t fulfill the training.
pli-tv-kd14:14.5.21: Accusations are unbeneficial and a cause of unhappiness for the general population; they are harmful, detrimental, and a cause of suffering for gods and humans.
pli-tv-kd14:14.5.22: Monks, when you see such a root of accusations either in yourself or in others, you should make an effort to get rid of it.
pli-tv-kd14:14.5.23: If you don’t see such a root either in yourself or in others, you should practice so that it doesn’t reappear in the future.
pli-tv-kd14:14.5.27: What are the three unwholesome roots of accusations?
pli-tv-kd14:14.5.28: It may be that monks, because of greed, because of ill will, because of delusion, accuse others of
pli-tv-kd14:14.5.29: failure in morality, failure in conduct, failure in view, or failure in livelihood.
pli-tv-kd14:14.5.31: What are the three wholesome roots of accusations?
pli-tv-kd14:14.5.32: It may be that monks, because of non-greed, because of non-ill will, because of non-delusion, accuse others of
pli-tv-kd14:14.5.33: failure in morality, failure in conduct, failure in view, or failure in livelihood.
pli-tv-kd14:14.5.35: How is the body a root of legal issues arising from accusations?
pli-tv-kd14:14.5.36: It may be that someone is ugly, unsightly, a dwarf, sickly, blind in one eye, crooked-limbed, lame, or paralyzed, and they blame him for that.
pli-tv-kd14:14.5.38: How is speech a root of legal issues arising from accusations?
pli-tv-kd14:14.5.39: It may be that someone is difficult to correct, or he stutters or dribbles while speaking, and they blame him for that.
pli-tv-kd14:14.6.1: (2c) What is the root of legal issues arising from offenses?
pli-tv-kd14:14.6.2: There are six origins of offenses that in turn are the root of legal issues arising from offenses.
pli-tv-kd14:14.6.3: There are offenses that originate from the body, but not from speech or the mind.
pli-tv-kd14:14.6.4: There are offenses that originate from speech, but not from the body or the mind.
pli-tv-kd14:14.6.5: There are offenses that originate from the body and speech, but not from the mind.
pli-tv-kd14:14.6.6: There are offenses that originate from the body and the mind, but not from speech.
pli-tv-kd14:14.6.7: There are offenses that originate from speech and the mind, but not from the body.
pli-tv-kd14:14.6.8: There are offenses that originate from the body, speech, and the mind.
pli-tv-kd14:14.7.1: (2d) What is the root of legal issues arising from business?
pli-tv-kd14:14.7.2: There is one root of legal issues arising from business:
pli-tv-kd14:14.8.1: (3a) Is a legal issue arising from a dispute wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate?
pli-tv-kd14:14.8.2: A legal issue arising from a dispute may be wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate.
pli-tv-kd14:14.8.3: What is a wholesome legal issue arising from a dispute?

pli-tv-kd14:14.8.19: In regard to this, whatever quarreling, arguing, conflict, disputing, variety in opinion, difference in opinion, heated speech, or strife there is—

pli-tv-kd14:14.9.1: (3b) Is a legal issue arising from an accusation wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate?
pli-tv-kd14:14.9.2: A legal issue arising from an accusation may be wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate.

pli-tv-kd14:14.9.9: It may be that monks with unwholesome minds accuse a monk

pli-tv-kd14:14.9.11: In regard to this, whatever accusation, accusing, allegation, blame, taking sides because of friendship, taking part in the accusation, or supporting the accusation there is—

pli-tv-kd14:14.9.13: What is an indeterminate legal issue arising from an accusation?

pli-tv-kd14:14.9.15: of failure in morality, failure in conduct, failure in view, or failure in livelihood.

pli-tv-kd14:14.9.18: (3c) Is a legal issue arising from an offense wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate?

pli-tv-kd14:14.11.1: (3d) Is a legal issues arising from business wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate?
pli-tv-kd14:14.11.2: A legal issue arising from business may be wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate.
pli-tv-kd14:14.11.3: What is a wholesome legal issue arising from business?
pli-tv-kd14:14.11.4: When the Sangha does a legal procedure with a wholesome mind—
pli-tv-kd14:14.11.5: whether a procedure consisting of getting permission, a procedure consisting of one motion, a procedure consisting of one motion and one announcement, or a procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements—
pli-tv-kd14:14.11.6: this is called a wholesome legal issue arising from business.
pli-tv-kd14:14.11.7: What is an unwholesome legal issue arising from business?
pli-tv-kd14:14.11.8: When the Sangha does a legal procedure with an unwholesome mind—
pli-tv-kd14:14.11.9: whether a procedure consisting of getting permission, a procedure consisting of one motion, a procedure consisting of one motion and one announcement, or a procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements—
pli-tv-kd14:14.11.10: this is called an unwholesome legal issue arising from business.
pli-tv-kd14:14.11.11: What is an indeterminate legal issue arising from business?
pli-tv-kd14:14.11.12: When the Sangha does a legal procedure with an indeterminate mind—
pli-tv-kd14:14.11.13: whether a procedure consisting of getting permission, a procedure consisting of one motion, a procedure consisting of one motion and one announcement, or a procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements—
pli-tv-kd14:14.11.14: this is called an indeterminate legal issue arising from business.
pli-tv-kd14:14.12.1: (4a) Are there disputes that are a legal issue arising from a dispute? Are there disputes that are not a legal issue? Are there legal issues that are not a dispute? Are there legal issues that are also a dispute?
pli-tv-kd14:14.12.2: There may be disputes that are a legal issue arising from a dispute; there may be disputes that are not a legal issue; there may legal issues that are not a dispute; there may be legal issues that are also a dispute.
pli-tv-kd14:14.12.3: How is there a dispute that is a legal issue arising from a dispute?
pli-tv-kd14:14.12.4: It may be that monks are disputing, saying,
pli-tv-kd14:14.12.5: ‘This is the Teaching’, or ‘This is contrary to the Teaching’ …
pli-tv-kd14:14.12.6: ‘This is a grave offense’, or ‘This is a minor offense.’
pli-tv-kd14:14.12.7: In regard to this, whatever there is of quarreling, arguing, conflict, disputing, variety in opinion, difference in opinion, heated speech, or strife—
pli-tv-kd14:14.12.8: this is a dispute that is a legal issue arising from a dispute.
pli-tv-kd14:14.12.9: How is there a dispute that is not a legal issue?
pli-tv-kd14:14.12.10: A mother disputes with her child; a child with their mother; a father with his child; a child with their father; a brother with his brother; a brother with his sister; a sister with her brother; a friend with their friend—
pli-tv-kd14:14.12.11: this is a dispute that is not a legal issue.
pli-tv-kd14:14.12.12: How is there a legal issue that is not a dispute?
pli-tv-kd14:14.12.13: A legal issue arising from an accusation, a legal issue arising from an offense, a legal issue arising from business—
pli-tv-kd14:14.12.14: this is a legal issue that is not a dispute.
pli-tv-kd14:14.12.15: How is there a legal issue that is also a dispute?
pli-tv-kd14:14.12.16: A legal issue arising from a dispute is a legal issue and also a dispute.
pli-tv-kd14:14.13.1: (4b) Are there accusations that are a legal issue arising from an accusation? Are there accusations that are not a legal issue? Are there legal issues that are not an accusation? Are there legal issues that are also an accusation?
pli-tv-kd14:14.13.2: There may be accusations that are a legal issue arising from an accusation; there may be accusations that are not a legal issue; there may be legal issues that are not an accusation; there may legal issues that are also an accusation.
pli-tv-kd14:14.13.3: How is there an accusation that is a legal issue arising from an accusation?
pli-tv-kd14:14.13.4: It may be that monks accuse a monk
pli-tv-kd14:14.13.5: of failure in morality, failure in conduct, failure in view, or failure in livelihood.
pli-tv-kd14:14.13.6: In regard to this, whatever there is of accusation, accusing, allegation, blame, taking sides because of friendship, taking part in the accusation, or supporting the accusation—
pli-tv-kd14:14.13.7: this is an accusation that is a legal issue arising from an accusation.
pli-tv-kd14:14.13.8: How is there an accusation that is not a legal issue?
pli-tv-kd14:14.13.9: A mother accuses her child; a child their mother; a father his child; a child their father; a brother his brother; a brother his sister; a sister her brother; a friend their friend—
pli-tv-kd14:14.13.10: this is an accusation that is not a legal issue.
pli-tv-kd14:14.13.11: How is there a legal issue that is not an accusation?
pli-tv-kd14:14.13.12: A legal issue arising from an offense, a legal issue arising from business, a legal issue arising from a dispute—
pli-tv-kd14:14.13.13: this is a legal issue that is not an accusation.
pli-tv-kd14:14.13.14: How is there a legal issue that is also an accusation?
pli-tv-kd14:14.13.15: A legal issue arising from an accusation is a legal issue and also an accusation.
pli-tv-kd14:14.14.1: (4c) Are there  offenses that are a legal issue arising from an offense? Are there offenses that are not a legal issue? Are there legal issues that are not an offense? Are there legal issues that are also an offense?
pli-tv-kd14:14.14.2: There may be offenses that are a legal issue arising from an offense; there may be offenses that are not a legal issue; there may be legal issues that are not an offense; there may be legal issues that are also an offense.
pli-tv-kd14:14.14.3: How is there an offense that is a legal issue arising from an offense?
pli-tv-kd14:14.14.4: There is a legal issue arising from an offense because of the five classes of offenses; there is a legal issue arising from an offense because of the seven classes of offenses—
pli-tv-kd14:14.14.5: this is an offense that is a legal issue arising from an offense.
pli-tv-kd14:14.14.6: How is there an offense that is not a legal issue?
pli-tv-kd14:14.14.8: this is an attainment/offense that is not a legal issue.
pli-tv-kd14:14.14.9: How is there a legal issue that is not an offense?
pli-tv-kd14:14.14.10: A legal issue arising from business, a legal issue arising from a dispute, a legal issue arising from an accusation—
pli-tv-kd14:14.14.11: this is a legal issue that is not an offense.
pli-tv-kd14:14.14.12: How is there a legal issue that is also an offense?
pli-tv-kd14:14.14.13: A legal issue arising from an offense is a legal issue and also an offense.
pli-tv-kd14:14.15.1: (4d) Is there business that is a legal issue arising from business? Is there business that is not a legal issue? Are there legal issues that are not business? Are there legal issues that are also business?
pli-tv-kd14:14.15.2: There may be business that is a legal issue arising from business; there may be business that is  not a legal issue; there may be legal issues that are not business; there may be legal issues that are also business.
pli-tv-kd14:14.15.3: How is there business that is a legal issue arising from business?
pli-tv-kd14:14.15.4: Whatever is the duty or the business of the Sangha—a legal procedure consisting of getting permission, a legal procedure consisting of one motion, a legal procedure consisting of one motion and one announcement, a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements—
pli-tv-kd14:14.15.5: this is business that is a legal issue arising from business.
pli-tv-kd14:14.15.6: How is there business that is not a legal issue?
pli-tv-kd14:14.15.7: The duty to teacher, the duty to a preceptor, the duty to a co-student, the duty to a co-pupil—
pli-tv-kd14:14.15.8: this is business that is not a legal issue.
pli-tv-kd14:14.15.9: How is there a legal issue that is not business?
pli-tv-kd14:14.15.10: A legal issue arising from a dispute, a legal issue arising from an accusation, a legal issue arising from an offense—
pli-tv-kd14:14.15.11: this is a legal issue that is not business.
pli-tv-kd14:14.15.12: How is there a legal issue that is also business?
pli-tv-kd14:14.15.13: A legal issue arising from business is a legal issue and also business.”

pli-tv-kd14:14.18.1: If those monks are unable to resolve that legal issue while on their way, they should go to that other monastery and say to the resident monks,
pli-tv-kd14:14.18.2: ‘A legal issue has arisen in such-and-such a way.
pli-tv-kd14:14.18.3: It would be good if you would resolve it according to the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Teacher’s instruction, so that this legal issue may be properly resolved.’
pli-tv-kd14:14.18.4: If the resident monks are senior to the visiting monks, the resident monks should say,
pli-tv-kd14:14.18.5: ‘Now, Venerables, please go to one side for a moment while we discuss this matter.’
pli-tv-kd14:14.18.6: If the visiting monks are senior to the resident monks, the resident monks should say,

pli-tv-kd14:14.18.8: If, while discussing that matter, the resident monks think,
pli-tv-kd14:14.18.9: ‘We’re unable to resolve this legal issue according to the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Teacher’s instruction,’ then they should not take on that legal issue.
pli-tv-kd14:14.18.11: ‘We’re able to resolve this legal issue according to the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Teacher’s instruction,’
pli-tv-kd14:14.18.12: then they should say to the visiting monks,

pli-tv-kd14:14.18.16: Dealing properly with the case in this way, the resident monks should take on that legal issue.

pli-tv-kd14:14.19.1: “If, while they are deliberating, there is endless talk, but not a single statement that is clear, then they should resolve that legal issue by means of a committee.
pli-tv-kd14:14.19.2: A monk who has ten qualities may be appointed to that committee:
pli-tv-kd14:14.19.3: One who is virtuous and restrained by the Monastic Code. His conduct is good, he associates with the right people, and he sees danger in minor faults. He undertakes and trains in the training rules.
pli-tv-kd14:14.19.4: One who has learned much, and who retains and accumulates what he has learned. Those teachings that are good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, that have a true goal and are well articulated, and that set out the perfectly complete and pure spiritual life—he has learned many such teachings, retained them in mind, recited them verbally, mentally investigated them, and penetrated them well by view.
pli-tv-kd14:14.19.5: One who has properly learned both Monastic Codes in detail; who has well analyzed them, thoroughly mastered them, and well investigated them, both in terms of the rules and their detailed exposition.
pli-tv-kd14:14.19.6: One who is firmly committed to the Monastic Law.
pli-tv-kd14:14.19.7: One who is capable of making both sides relax, of persuading them, of convincing them, of making them see, of reconciling them.
pli-tv-kd14:14.19.8: One who is knowledgeable about the arising and resolution of legal issues.
pli-tv-kd14:14.19.10: One who understands the arising of legal issues.
pli-tv-kd14:14.19.11: One who understands the ending of legal issues.
pli-tv-kd14:14.19.12: One who understands the way to the ending of legal issues.
pli-tv-kd14:14.20.1: And he should be appointed like this.
